prompt: <s> [INST] How is the cross entropy calculated for this example? [/INST] The cross entropy is calculated by using the formula H(p,q) = -p(h)log(q(h)) - p(t)log(q(t)), where p is the true distribution and q is the predicted distribution. </s>
questions: How is the cross entropy calculated for this example?

prompt: <s> [INST] How can you calculate the product of matrices? [/INST] The product of matrices A and B is a third matrix C, denoted as C = AB. If A is of shape m×n and B is of shape n×p, then C is of shape m×p. The product of matrices is associative, but not commutative. </s>
questions: How can you calculate the product of matrices?
answers: The product of matrices A and B is a third matrix C, denoted as C = AB. If A is of shape m×n and B is of shape n×p, then C is of shape m×p. The product of matrices is associative, but not commutative.

prompt: <s> [INST] What is the significance of matrix transpose? [/INST] Matrix transpose involves swapping the rows and columns of a matrix. questions: What is the significance of matrix transpose?
